Requirements: To be admitted, applicants are expected to meet the following criteria: High school students: a cumulative high school GPA of 2.0 or higher. Transfer students: a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher on all transferable college credit. In addition to the online application, applicants must submit: Official high school transcript. Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended.

Kansas residents who graduate from an accredited high school will be granted admission to Kansas State University by completing the pre-college curriculum and meeting one of the following requirements: Option 1 (test optional): Achieve a 3.25 or higher high school GPA. Option 2: Achieve a 21 or higher ACT composite score OR a 1060 or higher SAT ERW+M score AND achieve a 2.0 or higher high school GPA. Out-of-state residents who graduate from an accredited high school will be granted admission by completing the pre-college curriculum and meeting one of the following requirements: Option 1 (test optional): Achieve a 3.25 or higher high school GPA. Option 2: Achieve a 24 or higher ACT composite score OR a 1160 or higher SAT ERW+M score AND achieve a 2.5 or higher high school GPA.

To be considered for admission, you must complete the Kansas Qualified Admissions curriculum and meet one of the following requirements: A 3.25 or higher high school GPA OR an ACT composite score of 21 or higher OR an SAT ERW+M score of 1060 or higher. K-State has a test-optional admissions policy. If you have a test score, we recommend you submit it, as it can be used for scholarship consideration.
Program name: Bachelor of Hospitality and Tourism Management

Requirements:
To be admitted to K-State, you must meet the following requirements OR be predicted to meet them prior to your first day of classes at K-State:

Achieve a 3.25 or higher cumulative GPA on a 4.00 scale.

OR

Achieve a 2.0 or higher cumulative GPA on a 4.00 scale AND an ACT composite score of 21 or an SAT ERW+M score of 1060.

Students unable to take a standardized test may still be admitted to the university.
Program name: Bachelor of Parks, Recreation and Leisure Studies

Requirements: For guaranteed admission, Kansas residents must meet certain criteria, such as having an ACT composite score of 21 or higher (or SAT of 1060 or higher) and a cumulative high school GPA of 3.25 or higher, or a GPA of 3.25 or higher in the Kansas Scholars Curriculum. Non-residents must meet similar criteria. Kansas State University is test-optional through spring 2026. Applicants who do not meet the guaranteed requirements are considered for admission through an individual review process.

Admission to the Professional Program in Athletic Training is competitive. Minimum criteria to be eligible for admission includes a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.75 at the completion of the fall semester prior to the application deadline, a minimum grade of 'C' or better in all prerequisite and required program courses, and completion of a minimum of 50 hours of observation with a Certified Athletic Trainer (ATC). Applicants must submit a complete Professional Program Application Packet and participate in a formal interview. The application packet includes the completed application form, a current unofficial K-State transcript, a personal statement of professional goals, verification of observation hours, three recommendation forms, and a current resume.

To declare a major in CSD, you must have an established K-State GPA of 3.0 or higher. If you do not have an established K-State GPA (i.e., you are a first-semester freshman or transfer student), you may declare the major if your high school GPA or transfer GPA is 3.0 or higher.

For assured admission, Kansas residents who graduate from an accredited high school must meet one of the following criteria: an ACT score of 21 or higher, an SAT score of 1060 or higher, a cumulative high school GPA of 3.25 or higher, or rank in the top third of their graduating class. Students who are unable to take the ACT or SAT may be admitted with a GPA of 3.25 or higher. All applicants must also complete the pre-college curriculum, which includes 4 units of English, 3 units of Math, 3 units of Natural Science, and 3 units of Social Science.
Program name: Bachelor of Dietetics and Clinical Nutrition

Requirements:
Formal acceptance into the exercise physiology option is required for students to enroll in KIN 335, KIN 345, KIN 405, KIN 410, KIN 515, KIN 612 and KIN 616. To be formally accepted, students must have completed a minimum of 60 credit hours, a minimum overall GPA of 2.50, and completed the following courses with a grade of C or better: BIOL 198, BIOL 340, CHM 210, CHM 230, and MATH 100.

For students interested in transferring to Kansas State University, please contact the program director for more information on the application process.

Applicants may be admitted through assured admissions or holistic review. Assured admissions criteria require achieving a 21 or higher on the ACT OR a 1060 or higher on the SAT AND a cumulative high school GPA of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 scale, OR ranking in the top one-third of the graduating class. If an applicant does not meet the assured admissions criteria, their application will be holistically reviewed.

Kansas State University has test-optional admission standards. Freshman applicants who are Kansas residents, or a high school graduate from an accredited out-of-state or home school, are assured admission if they meet one of the following criteria:

With a test score:
Achieve an ACT composite score of 21 or higher OR a SAT ERW+M score of 1060 or higher, AND
Achieve a 2.0 GPA or higher on any college credit taken in high school.

Without a test score (Test-Optional):
Have a weighted or unweighted high school GPA of 3.25 or higher, AND
Achieve a 2.0 GPA or higher on any college credit taken in high school.

All students must complete the pre-college curriculum.
Program name: Bachelor of Foods, Nutrition, and Wellness Studies

Requirements: Achieve a 2.5+ high school GPA OR Achieve a 21+ ACT composite score or 1060+ SAT ERW+M score. In addition to the GPA or test score requirement, Kansas residents must also complete the Kansas Qualified Admissions curriculum in high school. Out-of-state residents must complete a college preparatory curriculum that includes four years of English, three years of math, three years of natural science, three years of social science and four years of electives.
Program name: Bachelor of Health Service Preparatory Studies

Requirements: To be eligible to apply for the professional program, students must: Have a minimum overall grade point average of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. Complete the required 94 credit hours of pre-professional coursework by the end of the spring semester of the junior year.

To be admitted to Kansas State University as a freshman, applicants must meet one of the following criteria: achieve an ACT composite score of 21 or higher OR an SAT ERW+M score of 1060 or higher; or have a cumulative GPA of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Kansas residents may also be admitted if they rank in the top one-third of their graduating class. Kansas State University is test-optional for admission, and students who are unable to take an ACT or SAT will not be disadvantaged in the admission process.
The minor requires 15 credit hours. A grade of C or better is required in all courses applied to the minor.
Program name: Minor in Adult Development, Gerontology, and Aging

Requirements: To declare the minor, you should schedule a meeting with the director, Dr. David A. N. Sly.

The minor in anthropology requires the completion of a minimum of 15 credit hours in anthropology, including ANTH 200 or ANTH 204 or ANTH 210. In addition to the introductory course, students must complete two courses (6 credit hours) from the following: ANTH 260; ANTH 501; ANTH 510. Students will take an additional 6 hours of anthropology electives, three of which must be at the 300 level or above. A grade of C or better is required for all courses used to fulfill the minor requirements.
